properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southerly winds will reach up to 100 kilometres per hour overnight tonight and Monday. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-08T01:10:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-07T09:11:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1495147489.2021
Area: Ivujivik, Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Falling snow combined with strong southerly winds will produce near-zero visibilities over these areas. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-08T01:25:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-07T09:26:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2529579475.2021
Area: Ivujivik, Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions, with visibilities below 400 m, will continue this morning. Strong winds and falling snow have combined to reduce the visibility in snow and blowing snow. Blizzard conditions will persist until early this afternoon when the winds begin to ease. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-07T22:59:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-07T15:25:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2539477941.2021
Area: Kugaaruk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard conditions today at Naujaat. Strong southeast winds and falling snow will combine to produce near-zero visibility in blowing snow at Naujaat today. Blizzard conditions will ease this evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-07T23:59:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-07T15:14:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0314822232.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Occasional snow squalls are expected. Locations: western Newfoundland. Time span: today and tonight. Total snowfall accumulations: 5 to 15 cm. Remarks: strong southwesterly winds will combine with periodic snow squalls to produce reduced visibility in blowing snow. Conditions favourable for snow squalls will diminish by Monday morning once the winds weaken and veer to the northwest. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-08T06:14:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-07T14:15:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1550944559.2021
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility, as low as 400 m, in snow and blowing snow will continue today. Strong winds with gusts to 90 km/h will continue to reduce the visibility in blowing snow. The winds will begin to ease tonight bringing an end to the blizzard. Blowing snow may linger into Monday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-08T07:26:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-07T15:27:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0940768088.2021
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard conditions expected across most of the Kivalliq region this weekend. As a low pressure system approaches from the Northwest Territories, an area of snow and strong southerly winds gusting from 60 to 80 km/h will produce blizzard conditions in a few communities. The blizzard in and Arviat is expected to end this evening. Blizzards for Rankin Inlet and Chesterfield Inlet should begin this evening and end Sunday morning. Finally, farther to the north and east in Naujaat, conditions will begin to worsen late this evening and ease Sunday afternoon. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-07T18:07:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-07T02:08:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3295522615.2021
Area: Arviat, Rankin Region including Whale Cove, Chesterfield Inlet, Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions, with visibilities below 400 m, will continue tonight. Strong winds and falling snow have combined to reduce the visibility in snow and blowing snow. Blizzard conditions will persist until early Sunday morning when the winds begin to ease. Snowfall will continue in the area through Sunday bringing up to 5 cm. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
